intro: Rhodocolea ranirisonii, commonly known as the Madagascar violet, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
